text: Outcry usually refers to a loud cry or a large protest, specifically it can refer to: * Outcry (mini-series), a 2020 documentary series on a wrongful imprisonment for child sexual assault * "Outcry" (song), a song by Dream Theater from their album A Dramatic Turn of Events * Outcry (video game), a first person psychological thriller point-and-click adventure video game * Outcry witness, in United States law, the person who first hears an allegation of abuse made by a child or another victim * Outcry auction or English auction, an open ascending dynamic auction * Open outcry, a method of communication between professionals on a stock exchange or futures exchange * The Outcry, a novel by Henry James published in 1911 == See also == * Brouhaha * Controversy * Dissent * Protest * Scandal
title: Outcry
